title: Bug 38131: ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
description:
I am using version 1.1rc1. This is a regression since rc1 and a deviation from javac. I suspect this may be related to a change in the underlying Eclipse compiler. To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 

1. Create a class in a subpackage like this: 

```java
package subpackage;

public class Test {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Hello");
    }
}
```

2. Compile using the following command: 

```shell
ajc subpackage\Test.java
```

3. The test.class file is placed in the subpackage\subpackage directory.

4. Running the java command results in the following error: 

```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test
```

5. The issue can be resolved by running either of the following commands: 

```shell
ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java
javac subpackage\Test.java
```

Adding the `-d .` option fixes the problem.
OB:
After executing the `ajc subpackage\Test.java` command, the test.class file is placed in the subpackage\subpackage directory. Running the java command results in the following error:

```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test
```
EB: The test.class file should be placed in the subpackage directory, and running the java command should not result in any error.
